question: Where did Jamie Freel and his mother live?
Who was the widow's sole support?
What did Jamie do every Saturday night?
answer1: poured his wages into her lap, thanked her dutifully for the halfpence which she returned him for tobacco

question: Where was the abode of the "wee folk"?
What did passerbys see every Halloween at the old ruined castle?
answer1: little figures fitted to and fro inside the building, while they heard the music of flutes and pipes

question: Why did Jamie want to go to the castle?
answer1: wondered what the inside of the castle was like

question: What made Jamie more determined to proceed?
What did the little people invite Jamie to do?
answer1: ride to Dublin to-night to steal a young lady

question: What did Jamie see when the troop dismounted near a window?
answer1: a beautiful face on a pillow in a splendid bed

question: Where did the young lady live?
How did Jamie know they were near his own house?
Why did Jamie not know what he was holding?
answer1: The little folk turned the lady into all sorts of strange shapes.

question: What did the lady try to do when she was a black dog?
What did the tiny woman do to the young girl?
How did Jamie's mother feel when Jamie brought home the young girl?
What did Jamie's mother take from "the room?"
answer1: her Sunday gown of brown drugget

question: Why did Jamie's mother give the girl these articles of attire?
answer1: She was willing to give even these to the fair trembling visitor.

question: What did Jamie say he would do when his mother asked how a lady could live on their poor diet?
How did the young lady feel for a long time?
What did Jamie do while the old woman span by the fire?
What did the young lady do whenever she perceived them looking at her>
Where did Jamie see bright lights in the castle windows?
What will happen if the young lady gets three drops out of the glass the tiny woman has in her hands?
answer1: Her hearing and speech will be back again.

question: What happened after Jamie snatched the glass from the tiny woman?
What were the lady's first words?
What did the lady want Jamie to get for her?
Why did the lady want paper, pen, and ink?
answer1: to write to her father and tell him what had become of her

question: Why did the lady decide to go to Dublin?
answer1: weeks passed and she received no answer

question: What happened after the lady impored Jamie?
answer1: Jamie consent to set out with her and walk all the way from Fannet to Dublin.

question: What was the name of the servant who opened the door?
How did the old gentleman feel when the lady called him her father?
Why was the old gentleman angry?
Who did the girl say would know her?
What was the girl's name?
What did Gracie show her mother?
Why did Gracie's mother still think her daughter was dead?
answer1: She saw her daughter in the coffin and saw the lind shut down upon her.

question: What did Jamie tell Gracie's parents?
answer1: the history of the fairy journey, of the theft of the young lady, of the figure he had seen laid in its place, of her life with his mother in Fannet, of last Halloween, and of the three drops that had released her from her enchantments

question: How did Gracie's parents treat Jamie?
Why did the daughter not let Jamie go without her?
answer1: He saved her from the fairies, and has worked for her ever since.

question: How did the mother come to Fannet?
Where did they all live together?
Who was heir to untold wealth at his father-in-law's death?
How did the neighbors know Jamie was the best son ever known or heard of?
answer1: Jamie took care of his mother well.
answer2: Jamie was the widow's sole supporter.
answer3: Jamie gave his mother his wages.

question: Why did Jamie never see his neighbors even though they lived closed to him?
answer2: His neighbors only came on May Eves or Halloweens.

question: Why did nobody have the courage to intrude in the old castle?
How did the widow feel when Jamie told her he wanted to go to the castle?
How will Jamie feel when he is warmly received by the little people?
Why did Jamie agree to steal a young lady with the little people?
answer2: He had too much fun with the little people.

question: Why was a stick left on the bed?
answer1: so it looked like the young lady was still there
answer2: so that it appeared that the young lady did not leave

question: Why did Jamie say he had the best of luck?
answer1: He partied with the little people.
answer3: He brought a young girl home.

question: Why did the widow feel bad for the young girl?
answer2: The young girl would have to eat the family's poor diet.
answer3: The young girl would have to live their poor way.

question: Why did the girl bury her face in her hands?
answer3: She did not want to be with Jamie.

question: What will Jamie do to seek his fortune?
answer3: do mischief with the wee folk

question: How did the wee folk feel towards Jamie?
Why did the wee folk treat Jamie kindly even though they disliked him?
answer1: They did not want him to know they disliked him.
answer2: They did not want trouble with him.
answer3: They did not want to be caught talking poorly about him.

question: How will the lady feel when neither the servant nor her father recognizes her?
Why did the lady tell her father to look at the ring on her finger?
answer1: It had their names on it.
answer2: to prove she was his daughter
answer3: to show she was neither dead nor buried

question: Why did the old gentleman make Jamie his son-in-law?
answer1: His daughter wanted to be with Jamie.
answer2: His daughter did not want to separate from Jamie.
